      UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/98.0.4758.102 Safari/537.36<span class="line"><!---->UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/98.0.4758.102 Safari/537.36<!----></span><br><br>Steps to reproduce the problem:<span class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></span><br>1.build a linux-chromeos tsan version<span class="line"><!---->1.build a linux-chromeos tsan version<!----></span><br>2.<span class="line"><!---->2.<!----></span><br>out/tsan/chrome  then it will check crash<span class="line"><!---->out/tsan/chrome  then it will check crash<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>2022-02-21T03:22:29.458803Z FATAL chrome[47978:47978]: [zygote_host_impl_linux.cc(117)] No usable sandbox! Update your kernel or see <span class="line"><!---->2022-02-21T03:22:29.458803Z FATAL chrome[47978:47978]: [zygote_host_impl_linux.cc(117)] No usable sandbox! Update your kernel or see <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/main/docs/linux/suid_sandbox_development.md<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/main/docs/linux/suid_sandbox_development.md"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/main/docs/linux/suid_sandbox_development.md<!----></a> for more information on developing with the SUID sandbox. If you want to live dangerously and need an immediate workaround, you can try using --no-sandbox<span class="line"><!----> for more information on developing with the SUID sandbox. If you want to live dangerously and need an immediate workaround, you can try using --no-sandbox<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>3.out/tsan/chrome --no-sandbox  then it will show serveral data race.<span class="line"><!---->3.out/tsan/chrome --no-sandbox  then it will show serveral data race.<!----></span><br><br>What is the expected behavior?<span class="line"><!---->What is the expected behavior?<!----></span><br><br>What went wrong?<span class="line"><!---->What went wrong?<!----></span><br>above all<span class="line"><!---->above all<!----></span><br><br>Did this work before?           <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        CommandLine is okay to read across threads.<span class="line"><!---->CommandLine is okay to read across threads.<!----></span><br><br>  // Get the singleton CommandLine representing the current process's<span class="line"><!---->  // Get the singleton CommandLine representing the current process's<!----></span><br>  // command line. Note: returned value is mutable, but not thread safe;<span class="line"><!---->  // command line. Note: returned value is mutable, but not thread safe;<!----></span><br>  // only mutate if you know what you're doing!<span class="line"><!---->  // only mutate if you know what you're doing!<!----></span><br>  static CommandLine* ForCurrentProcess();<span class="line"><!---->  static CommandLine* ForCurrentProcess();<!----></span><br><br>But not to edit.<span class="line"><!---->But not to edit.<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ash/display/window_tree_host_manager.cc;drc=29350263b305b4713eda73bd86ba1cd5ddd4f540;l=888<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ash/display/window_tree_host_manager.cc;drc=29350263b305b4713eda73bd86ba1cd5ddd4f540;l=888"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ash/display/window_tree_host_manager.cc;drc=29350263b305b4713eda73bd86ba1cd5ddd4f540;l=888<!----></a><br><br>WindowTreeHostManager is writing to the CommandLine after initialization which is bad and creates this thread race. It could be a security bug as the data structure behind CommandLine contains pointers and the update could leave pointers in a bad state. However it would not be reliable for a renderer to exploit likely. So I will degrade the impact from critical.<span class="line"><!---->WindowTreeHostManager is writing to the CommandLine after initialization which is bad and creates this thread race. It could be a security bug as the data structure behind CommandLine contains pointers and the update could leave pointers in a bad state. However it would not be reliable for a renderer to exploit likely. So I will degrade the impact from critical.<!----></span><br><br>This bug was introduced here: <span class="line"><!---->This bug was introduced here: <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/3fcfa32692cd6506ecb8ed3a5a5f492ed750ab8c<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/3fcfa32692cd6506ecb8ed3a5a5f492ed750ab8c"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/3fcfa32692cd6506ecb8ed3a5a5f492ed750ab8c<!----></a><br><br><br>Temporary fix for rendering corruption on 4K or larger displays.<span class="line"><!---->Temporary fix for rendering corruption on 4K or larger displays.<!----></span><br><br>This change temporarily increases the compositor memory limit for<span class="line"><!---->This change temporarily increases the compositor memory limit for<!----></span><br>displays that are 4K or larger. The rendering was using up more memory<span class="line"><!---->displays that are 4K or larger. The rendering was using up more memory<!----></span><br>than expected, hitting the limit and causing parts of the UI to not be<span class="line"><!---->than expected, hitting the limit and causing parts of the UI to not be<!----></span><br>rendered.<span class="line"><!---->rendered.<!----></span><br><br>Tested with emulator with a large display size and confirmed the memory<span class="line"><!---->Tested with emulator with a large display size and confirmed the memory<!----></span><br>limit was increased.<span class="line"><!---->limit was increased.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1261776<span class="line"><!---->Bug: 1261776<!----></span><br>Change-Id: I502323d6098fda5d96cb28c76aad4debecd3d3ee<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: I502323d6098fda5d96cb28c76aad4debecd3d3ee<!----></span><br>Reviewed-on: <span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-on: <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3413653<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3413653"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3413653<!----></a><br>Reviewed-by: Mitsuru Oshima <<span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-by: Mitsuru Oshima &lt;<!----></span>oshima@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/oshima@chromium.org"><!---->oshima@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br><br>The fix is to mutate the CommandLine at startup and not after other threads have started.<span class="line"><!---->The fix is to mutate the CommandLine at startup and not after other threads have started.<!----></span><br><br>The CL was merged to M99, otherwise it would be only on M100.<span class="line"><!---->The CL was merged to M99, otherwise it would be only on M100.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

        from sanitizer output, your file seems run in main thread, but the function ```PosixSystemProducer::DelayedReconnect()``` <span class="line"><!---->from sanitizer output, your file seems run in main thread, but the function ```PosixSystemProducer::DelayedReconnect()``` <!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>  task_runner()->GetOrCreateTaskRunner()->PostDelayedTask(<span class="line"><!---->  task_runner()-&gt;GetOrCreateTaskRunner()-&gt;PostDelayedTask(<!----></span><br>      FROM_HERE,<span class="line"><!---->      FROM_HERE,<!----></span><br>      base::BindOnce(<span class="line"><!---->      base::BindOnce(<!----></span><br>          [](base::WeakPtr<PosixSystemProducer> weak_ptr) {<span class="line"><!---->          [](base::WeakPtr&lt;PosixSystemProducer&gt;  // here will cause data race.<span class="line"><!---->              weak_ptr-&gt;Connect();  // here will cause data race.<!----></span><br>            } else {<span class="line"><!---->            } else {<!----></span><br>              weak_ptr->DelayedReconnect();<span class="line"><!---->              weak_ptr-&gt;DelayedReconnect();<!----></span><br>            }<span class="line"><!---->            }<!----></span><br>          },<span class="line"><!---->          },<!----></span><br>          weak_ptr_factory_.GetWeakPtr()),<span class="line"><!---->          weak_ptr_factory_.GetWeakPtr()),<!----></span><br>      base::Milliseconds(connection_backoff_ms_));<span class="line"><!---->      base::Milliseconds(connection_backoff_ms_));<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>maybe you can CC <span class="line"><!---->maybe you can CC <!----></span>nuskos@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/nuskos@chromium.org"><!---->nuskos@chromium.org<!----></a> to look at this bug.<span class="line"><!----> to look at this bug.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

    <mr-issue-details class="main-item"><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-details {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background-color: var(--chops-white);
          padding-bottom: 1em;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;

          margin: 0;

          margin-top: 1em;

          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        mr-edit-issue {
          margin-top: 40px;

      </style>
      <mr-description></mr-description>
      <mr-comment-list headinglevel="2"></mr-comment-list>
      
    <!----></mr-issue-details>
              
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      
        mr-launch-overview {
          max-width: 100%;
          display: flex;
          flex-flow: column;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          align-items: stretch;
        }
        mr-launch-overview[hidden] {
          display: none;
        }
        mr-phase {
          margin-bottom: 0.75em;
        }

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

      <style>

        }

          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;

          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;

          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;

    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;

    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);

  }

    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.

  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>


          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;

            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {

          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        CommandLine is okay to read across threads.<span class="line"><!---->CommandLine is okay to read across threads.<!----></span><br><br>  // Get the singleton CommandLine representing the current process's<span class="line"><!---->  // Get the singleton CommandLine representing the current process's<!----></span><br>  // command line. Note: returned value is mutable, but not thread safe;<span class="line"><!---->  // command line. Note: returned value is mutable, but not thread safe;<!----></span><br>  // only mutate if you know what you're doing!<span class="line"><!---->  // only mutate if you know what you're doing!<!----></span><br>  static CommandLine* ForCurrentProcess();<span class="line"><!---->  static CommandLine* ForCurrentProcess();<!----></span><br><br>But not to edit.<span class="line"><!---->But not to edit.<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ash/display/window_tree_host_manager.cc;drc=29350263b305b4713eda73bd86ba1cd5ddd4f540;l=888<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ash/display/window_tree_host_manager.cc;drc=29350263b305b4713eda73bd86ba1cd5ddd4f540;l=888"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ash/display/window_tree_host_manager.cc;drc=29350263b305b4713eda73bd86ba1cd5ddd4f540;l=888<!----></a><br><br>WindowTreeHostManager is writing to the CommandLine after initialization which is bad and creates this thread race. It could be a security bug as the data structure behind CommandLine contains pointers and the update could leave pointers in a bad state. However it would not be reliable for a renderer to exploit likely. So I will degrade the impact from critical.<span class="line"><!---->WindowTreeHostManager is writing to the CommandLine after initialization which is bad and creates this thread race. It could be a security bug as the data structure behind CommandLine contains pointers and the update could leave pointers in a bad state. However it would not be reliable for a renderer to exploit likely. So I will degrade the impact from critical.<!----></span><br><br>This bug was introduced here: <span class="line"><!---->This bug was introduced here: <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/3fcfa32692cd6506ecb8ed3a5a5f492ed750ab8c<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/3fcfa32692cd6506ecb8ed3a5a5f492ed750ab8c"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/3fcfa32692cd6506ecb8ed3a5a5f492ed750ab8c<!----></a><br><br><br>Temporary fix for rendering corruption on 4K or larger displays.<span class="line"><!---->Temporary fix for rendering corruption on 4K or larger displays.<!----></span><br><br>This change temporarily increases the compositor memory limit for<span class="line"><!---->This change temporarily increases the compositor memory limit for<!----></span><br>displays that are 4K or larger. The rendering was using up more memory<span class="line"><!---->displays that are 4K or larger. The rendering was using up more memory<!----></span><br>than expected, hitting the limit and causing parts of the UI to not be<span class="line"><!---->than expected, hitting the limit and causing parts of the UI to not be<!----></span><br>rendered.<span class="line"><!---->rendered.<!----></span><br><br>Tested with emulator with a large display size and confirmed the memory<span class="line"><!---->Tested with emulator with a large display size and confirmed the memory<!----></span><br>limit was increased.<span class="line"><!---->limit was increased.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1261776<span class="line"><!---->Bug: 1261776<!----></span><br>Change-Id: I502323d6098fda5d96cb28c76aad4debecd3d3ee<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: I502323d6098fda5d96cb28c76aad4debecd3d3ee<!----></span><br>Reviewed-on: <span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-on: <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3413653<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3413653"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3413653<!----></a><br>Reviewed-by: Mitsuru Oshima <<span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-by: Mitsuru Oshima &lt;<!----></span>oshima@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/oshima@chromium.org"><!---->oshima@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br><br>The fix is to mutate the CommandLine at startup and not after other threads have started.<span class="line"><!---->The fix is to mutate the CommandLine at startup and not after other threads have started.<!----></span><br><br>The CL was merged to M99, otherwise it would be only on M100.<span class="line"><!---->The CL was merged to M99, otherwise it would be only on M100.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      </div><br>
    
        
      
        This is a serious security regression. If you are not able to fix this quickly, please revert the change that introduced it.<span class="line"><!---->This is a serious security regression.         from sanitizer output, your file seems run in main thread, but the function ```PosixSystemProducer::DelayedReconnect()``` <span class="line"><!---->from sanitizer output, your file seems run in main thread, but the function ```PosixSystemProducer::DelayedReconnect()``` <!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>  task_runner()->GetOrCreateTaskRunner()->PostDelayedTask(<span class="line"><!---->  task_runner()-&gt;GetOrCreateTaskRunner()-&gt;PostDelayedTask(<!----></span><br>      FROM_HERE,<span class="line"><!---->      FROM_HERE,<!----></span><br>      base::BindOnce(<span class="line"><!---->      base::BindOnce(<!----></span><br>          [](base::WeakPtr<PosixSystemProducer> weak_ptr) {<span class="line"><!---->          [](base::WeakPtr&lt;PosixSystemProducer&gt; weak_ptr) {<!----></span><br>            if (!weak_ptr) {<span class="line"><!---->            if (!weak_ptr) {<!----></span><br>              return;<span class="line"><!---->              return;<!----></span><br>            }<span class="line"><!---->            }<!----></span><br>            weak_ptr->retrying_ = false;<span class="line"><!---->            weak_ptr-&gt;retrying_ = false;<!----></span><br>            if (PerfettoTracedProcess::Get()->CanStartTracing(<span class="line"><!---->            if (PerfettoTracedProcess::Get()-&gt;CanStartTracing(<!----></span><br>                    weak_ptr.get(), base::OnceClosure())) {<span class="line"><!---->                    weak_ptr.get(), base::OnceClosure())) {<!----></span><br>              weak_ptr->Connect();  // here will cause data race.<span class="line"><!---->              weak_ptr-&gt;Connect();  // here will cause data race.<!----></span><br>            } else {<span class="line"><!---->            } else {<!----></span><br>              weak_ptr->DelayedReconnect();<span class="line"><!---->              weak_ptr-&gt;DelayedReconnect();<!----></span><br>            }<span class="line"><!---->            }<!----></span><br>          },<span class="line"><!---->          },<!----></span><br>          weak_ptr_factory_.GetWeakPtr()),<span class="line"><!---->          weak_ptr_factory_.GetWeakPtr()),<!----></span><br>      base::Milliseconds(connection_backoff_ms_));<span class="line"><!---->      base::Milliseconds(connection_backoff_ms_));<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>maybe you can CC <span class="line"><!---->maybe you can CC <!----></span>nuskos@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/nuskos@chromium.org"><!---->nuskos@chromium.org<!----></a> to look at this bug.<span class="line"><!----> to look at this bug.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        LTS Milestone M96<span class="line"><!---->LTS Milestone M96<!----></span><br><br>This issue has been flagged as a merge candidate for Chrome OS' LTS channel. If selected, our merge team will handle any additional merges. To help us determine if this issue requires a merge to LTS, please answer this short questionnaire:<span class="line"><!---->This issue has been flagged as a merge candidate for Chrome OS' LTS channel. If selected, our merge team will handle any additional merges. To help us determine if this issue requires a merge to LTS, please answer this short questionnaire:<!----></span><br>1. Was this issue a regression for the milestone it was found in?<span class="line"><!---->1. Was this issue a regression for the milestone it was found in?<!----></span><br>2. Is this issue related to a change or feature merged after the latest LTS Milestone?<span class="line"><!---->2. Is this issue related to a change or feature merged after the latest LTS Milestone?<!----></span><br><br><br><br>For more details visit <span class="line"><!---->For more details visit <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<!----></a> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<span class="line"><!----> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>

         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>

        for LitElement.

          Blocked on issues<span>Blocked on issues</span>
          
            close<i class="material-icons">close</i>
          <button aria-label="close">
            <i class="material-icons">close</i>
          </button>
        <h3 class="medium-heading">
          <span>Blocked on issues</span>
          <button aria-label="close">
            <i class="material-icons">close</i>
          </button>
        </h3>

      <chops-dialog closeonoutsideclick="">
        <h3 class="medium-heading">
          <span>Blocked on issues</span>
          <button aria-label="close">
            <i class="material-icons">close</i>
          </button>
        </h3>
        
        <table><tbody>
          <tr>
            
            <!---->
              <th><!---->Issue<!----></th>
            <!---->
              <th><!---->Summary<!----></th>
            <!---->
          </tr>

          
        </tbody></table>
      </chops-dialog>
    <mr-related-issues id="reorder-related-issues"></mr-related-issues>
        
    <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it

      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        CommandLine is okay to read across threads.<span class="line"><!---->CommandLine is okay to read across threads.<!----></span><br><br>  // Get the singleton CommandLine representing the current process's<span class="line"><!---->  // Get the singleton CommandLine representing the current process's<!----></span><br>  // command line. Note: returned value is mutable, but not thread safe;<span class="line"><!---->  // command line. Note: returned value is mutable, but not thread safe;<!----></span><br>  // only mutate if you know what you're doing!<span class="line"><!---->  // only mutate if you know what you're doing!<!----></span><br>  static CommandLine* ForCurrentProcess();<span class="line"><!---->  static CommandLine* ForCurrentProcess();<!----></span><br><br>But not to edit.<span class="line"><!---->But not to edit.<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ash/display/window_tree_host_manager.cc;drc=29350263b305b4713eda73bd86ba1cd5ddd4f540;l=888<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ash/display/window_tree_host_manager.cc;drc=29350263b305b4713eda73bd86ba1cd5ddd4f540;l=888"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ash/display/window_tree_host_manager.cc;drc=29350263b305b4713eda73bd86ba1cd5ddd4f540;l=888<!----></a><br><br>WindowTreeHostManager is writing to the CommandLine after initialization which is bad and creates this thread race. It could be a security bug as the data structure behind CommandLine contains pointers and the update could leave pointers in a bad state. However it would not be reliable for a renderer to exploit likely. So I will degrade the impact from critical.<span class="line"><!---->WindowTreeHostManager is writing to the CommandLine after initialization which is bad and creates this thread race. It could be a security bug as the data structure behind CommandLine contains pointers and the update could leave pointers in a bad state. However it would not be reliable for a renderer to exploit likely. So I will degrade the impact from critical.<!----></span><br><br>This bug was introduced here: <span class="line"><!---->This bug was introduced here: <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/3fcfa32692cd6506ecb8ed3a5a5f492ed750ab8c<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/3fcfa32692cd6506ecb8ed3a5a5f492ed750ab8c"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/3fcfa32692cd6506ecb8ed3a5a5f492ed750ab8c<!----></a><br><br><br>Temporary fix for rendering corruption on 4K or larger displays.<span class="line"><!---->Temporary fix for rendering corruption on 4K or larger displays.<!----></span><br><br>This change temporarily increases the compositor memory limit for<span class="line"><!---->This change temporarily increases the compositor memory limit for<!----></span><br>displays that are 4K or larger. The rendering was using up more memory<span class="line"><!---->displays that are 4K or larger. The rendering was using up more memory<!----></span><br>than expected, hitting the limit and causing parts of the UI to not be<span class="line"><!---->than expected, hitting the limit and causing parts of the UI to not be<!----></span><br>rendered.<span class="line"><!---->rendered.<!----></span><br><br>Tested with emulator with a large display size and confirmed the memory<span class="line"><!---->Tested with emulator with a large display size and confirmed the memory<!----></span><br>limit was increased.<span class="line"><!---->limit was increased.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1261776<span class="line"><!---->Bug: 1261776<!----></span><br>Change-Id: I502323d6098fda5d96cb28c76aad4debecd3d3ee<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: I502323d6098fda5d96cb28c76aad4debecd3d3ee<!----></span><br>Reviewed-on: <span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-on: <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3413653<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3413653"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3413653<!----></a><br>Reviewed-by: Mitsuru Oshima <<span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-by: Mitsuru Oshima &lt;<!----></span>oshima@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/oshima@chromium.org"><!---->oshima@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br><br>The fix is to mutate the CommandLine at startup and not after other threads have started.<span class="line"><!---->The fix is to mutate the CommandLine at startup and not after other threads have started.<!----></span><br><br>The CL was merged to M99, otherwise it would be only on M100.<span class="line"><!---->The CL was merged to M99, otherwise it would be only on M100.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        from sanitizer output, your file seems run in main thread, but the function ```PosixSystemProducer::DelayedReconnect()``` <span class="line"><!---->from sanitizer output, your file seems run in main thread, but the function ```PosixSystemProducer::DelayedReconnect()``` <!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>  task_runner()->GetOrCreateTaskRunner()->PostDelayedTask(<span class="line"><!---->  task_runner()-&gt;GetOrCreateTaskRunner()-&gt;PostDelayedTask(<!----></span><br>      FROM_HERE,<span class="line"><!---->      FROM_HERE,<!----></span><br>      base::BindOnce(<span class="line"><!---->      base::BindOnce(<!----></span><br>          [](base::WeakPtr<PosixSystemProducer> weak_ptr) {<span class="line"><!---->          [](base::WeakPtr&lt;PosixSystemProducer&gt; weak_ptr) {<!----></span><br>            if (!weak_ptr) {<span class="line"><!---->            if (!weak_ptr) {<!----></span><br>              return;<span class="line"><!---->              return;<!----></span><br>            }<span class="line"><!---->            }<!----></span><br>            weak_ptr->retrying_ = false;<span class="line"><!---->            weak_ptr-&gt;retrying_ = false;<!----></span><br>            if (PerfettoTracedProcess::Get()->CanStartTracing(<span class="line"><!---->            if (PerfettoTracedProcess::Get()-&gt;CanStartTracing(<!----></span><br>                    weak_ptr.get(), base::OnceClosure())) {<span class="line"><!---->                    weak_ptr.get(), base::OnceClosure())) {<!----></span><br>              weak_ptr->Connect();  // here will cause data race.<span class="line"><!---->              weak_ptr-&gt;Connect();  // here will cause data race.<!----></span><br>            } else {<span class="line"><!---->            } else {<!----></span><br>              weak_ptr->DelayedReconnect();<span class="line"><!---->              weak_ptr-&gt;DelayedReconnect();<!----></span><br>            }<span class="line"><!---->            }<!----></span><br>          },<span class="line"><!---->          },<!----></span><br>          weak_ptr_factory_.GetWeakPtr()),<span class="line"><!---->          weak_ptr_factory_.GetWeakPtr()),<!----></span><br>      base::Milliseconds(connection_backoff_ms_));<span class="line"><!---->      base::Milliseconds(connection_backoff_ms_));<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>maybe you can CC <span class="line"><!---->maybe you can CC <!----></span>nuskos@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/nuskos@chromium.org"><!---->nuskos@chromium.org<!----></a> to look at this bug.<span class="line"><!----> to look at this bug.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

          <h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          <div class="input-grid">
            <label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">

      </label>

    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);

          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }

            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }

            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

          (was: Unconfirmed)

        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Owner:</strong>

          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Cc:</strong>

        CommandLine is okay to read across threads.<span class="line"><!---->CommandLine is okay to read across threads.<!----></span><br><br>  // Get the singleton CommandLine representing the current process's<span class="line"><!---->  // Get the singleton CommandLine representing the current process's<!----></span><br>  // command line. Note: returned value is mutable, but not thread safe;<span class="line"><!---->  // command line. Note: returned value is mutable, but not thread safe;<!----></span><br>  // only mutate if you know what you're doing!<span class="line"><!---->  // only mutate if you know what you're doing!<!----></span><br>  static CommandLine* ForCurrentProcess();<span class="line"><!---->  static CommandLine* ForCurrentProcess();<!----></span><br><br>But not to edit.<span class="line"><!---->But not to edit.<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ash/display/window_tree_host_manager.cc;drc=29350263b305b4713eda73bd86ba1cd5ddd4f540;l=888<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ash/display/window_tree_host_manager.cc;drc=29350263b305b4713eda73bd86ba1cd5ddd4f540;l=888"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ash/display/window_tree_host_manager.cc;drc=29350263b305b4713eda73bd86ba1cd5ddd4f540;l=888<!----></a><br><br>WindowTreeHostManager is writing to the CommandLine after initialization which is bad and creates this thread race. It could be a security bug as the data structure behind CommandLine contains pointers and the update could leave pointers in a bad state. However it would not be reliable for a renderer to exploit likely. So I will degrade the impact from critical.<span class="line"><!---->WindowTreeHostManager is writing to the CommandLine after initialization which is bad and creates this thread race. It could be a security bug as the data structure behind CommandLine contains pointers and the update could leave pointers in a bad state. However it would not be reliable for a renderer to exploit likely. So I will degrade the impact from critical.<!----></span><br><br>This bug was introduced here: <span class="line"><!---->This bug was introduced here: <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/3fcfa32692cd6506ecb8ed3a5a5f492ed750ab8c<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/3fcfa32692cd6506ecb8ed3a5a5f492ed750ab8c"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/3fcfa32692cd6506ecb8ed3a5a5f492ed750ab8c<!----></a><br><br><br>Temporary fix for rendering corruption on 4K or larger displays.<span class="line"><!---->Temporary fix for rendering corruption on 4K or larger displays.<!----></span><br><br>This change temporarily increases the compositor memory limit for<span class="line"><!---->This change temporarily increases the compositor memory limit for<!----></span><br>displays that are 4K or larger. The rendering was using up more memory<span class="line"><!---->displays that are 4K or larger. The rendering was using up more memory<!----></span><br>than expected, hitting the limit and causing parts of the UI to not be<span class="line"><!---->than expected, hitting the limit and causing parts of the UI to not be<!----></span><br>rendered.<span class="line"><!---->rendered.<!----></span><br><br>Tested with emulator with a large display size and confirmed the memory<span class="line"><!---->Tested with emulator with a large display size and confirmed the memory<!----></span><br>limit was increased.<span class="line"><!---->limit was increased.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1261776<span class="line"><!---->Bug: 1261776<!----></span><br>Change-Id: I502323d6098fda5d96cb28c76aad4debecd3d3ee<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: I502323d6098fda5d96cb28c76aad4debecd3d3ee<!----></span><br>Reviewed-on: <span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-on: <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3413653<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3413653"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3413653<!----></a><br>Reviewed-by: Mitsuru Oshima <<span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-by: Mitsuru Oshima &lt;<!----></span>oshima@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/oshima@chromium.org"><!---->oshima@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br><br>The fix is to mutate the CommandLine at startup and not after other threads have started.<span class="line"><!---->The fix is to mutate the CommandLine at startup and not after other threads have started.<!----></span><br><br>The CL was merged to M99, otherwise it would be only on M100.<span class="line"><!---->The CL was merged to M99, otherwise it would be only on M100.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

          Comment 9<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1299331#c9">Comment 9<!----></a>

        from sanitizer output, your file seems run in main thread, but the function ```PosixSystemProducer::DelayedReconnect()``` <span class="line"><!---->from sanitizer output, your file seems run in main thread, but the function ```PosixSystemProducer::DelayedReconnect()``` <!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>  task_runner()->GetOrCreateTaskRunner()->PostDelayedTask(<span class="line"><!---->  task_runner()-&gt;GetOrCreateTaskRunner()-&gt;PostDelayedTask(<!----></span><br>      FROM_HERE,<span class="line"><!---->      FROM_HERE,<!----></span><br>      base::BindOnce(<span class="line"><!---->      base::BindOnce(<!----></span><br>          [](base::WeakPtr<PosixSystemProducer> weak_ptr) {<span class="line"><!---->          [](base::WeakPtr&lt;PosixSystemProducer&gt;       <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Assigned
          (was: Unconfirmed)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          aluh@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
