      </div><br>
    
        
      
        CommandLine is okay to read across threads.<span class="line"><!---->CommandLine is okay to read across threads.<!----></span><br><br>  // Get the singleton CommandLine representing the current process's<span class="line"><!---->  // Get the singleton CommandLine representing the current process's<!----></span><br>  // command line. Note: returned value is mutable, but not thread safe;<span class="line"><!---->  // command line. Note: returned value is mutable, but not thread safe;<!----></span><br>  // only mutate if you know what you're doing!<span class="line"><!---->  // only mutate if you know what you're doing!<!----></span><br>  static CommandLine* ForCurrentProcess();<span class="line"><!---->  static CommandLine* ForCurrentProcess();<!----></span><br><br>But not to edit.<span class="line"><!---->But not to edit.<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ash/display/window_tree_host_manager.cc;drc=29350263b305b4713eda73bd86ba1cd5ddd4f540;l=888<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ash/display/window_tree_host_manager.cc;drc=29350263b305b4713eda73bd86ba1cd5ddd4f540;l=888"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ash/display/window_tree_host_manager.cc;drc=29350263b305b4713eda73bd86ba1cd5ddd4f540;l=888<!----></a><br><br>WindowTreeHostManager is writing to the CommandLine after initialization which is bad and creates this thread race. It could be a security bug as the data structure behind CommandLine contains pointers and the update could leave pointers in a bad state. However it would not be reliable for a renderer to exploit likely. So I will degrade the impact from critical.<span class="line"><!---->WindowTreeHostManager is writing to the CommandLine after initialization which is bad and creates this thread race. It could be a security bug as the data structure behind CommandLine contains pointers and the update could leave pointers in a bad state. However it would not be reliable for a renderer to exploit likely. So I will degrade the impact from critical.<!----></span><br><br>This bug was introduced here: <span class="line"><!---->This bug was introduced here: <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/3fcfa32692cd6506ecb8ed3a5a5f492ed750ab8c<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/3fcfa32692cd6506ecb8ed3a5a5f492ed750ab8c"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/3fcfa32692cd6506ecb8ed3a5a5f492ed750ab8c<!----></a><br><br><br>Temporary fix for rendering corruption on 4K or larger displays.<span class="line"><!---->Temporary fix for rendering corruption on 4K or larger displays.<!----></span><br><br>This change temporarily increases the compositor memory limit for<span class="line"><!---->This change temporarily increases the compositor memory limit for<!----></span><br>displays that are 4K or larger. The rendering was using up more memory<span class="line"><!---->displays that are 4K or larger. The rendering was using up more memory<!----></span><br>than expected, hitting the limit and causing parts of the UI to not be<span class="line"><!---->than expected, hitting the limit and causing parts of the UI to not be<!----></span><br>rendered.<span class="line"><!---->rendered.<!----></span><br><br>Tested with emulator with a large display size and confirmed the memory<span class="line"><!---->Tested with emulator with a large display size and confirmed the memory<!----></span><br>limit was increased.<span class="line"><!---->limit was increased.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1261776<span class="line"><!---->Bug: 1261776<!----></span><br>Change-Id: I502323d6098fda5d96cb28c76aad4debecd3d3ee<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: I502323d6098fda5d96cb28c76aad4debecd3d3ee<!----></span><br>Reviewed-on: <span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-on: <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3413653<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3413653"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3413653<!----></a><br>Reviewed-by: Mitsuru Oshima <<span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-by: Mitsuru Oshima &lt;<!----></span>oshima@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/oshima@chromium.org"><!---->oshima@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br><br>The fix is to mutate the CommandLine at startup and not after other threads have started.<span class="line"><!---->The fix is to mutate the CommandLine at startup and not after other threads have started.<!----></span><br><br>The CL was merged to M99, otherwise it would be only on M100.<span class="line"><!---->The CL was merged to M99, otherwise it would be only on M100.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        from sanitizer output, your file seems run in main thread, but the function ```PosixSystemProducer::DelayedReconnect()``` <span class="line"><!---->from sanitizer output, your file seems run in main thread, but the function ```PosixSystemProducer::DelayedReconnect()``` <!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>  task_runner()->GetOrCreateTaskRunner()->PostDelayedTask(<span class="line"><!---->  task_runner()-&gt;GetOrCreateTaskRunner()-&gt;PostDelayedTask(<!----></span><br>      FROM_HERE,<span class="line"><!---->      FROM_HERE,<!----></span><br>      base::BindOnce(<span class="line"><!---->      base::BindOnce(<!----></span><br>          [](base::WeakPtr<PosixSystemProducer> weak_ptr) {<span class="line"><!---->          [](base::WeakPtr&lt;PosixSystemProducer&gt; weak_ptr) {<!----></span><br>            if (!weak_ptr) {<span class="line"><!---->            if (!weak_ptr) {<!----></span><br>              return;<span class="line"><!---->              return;<!----></span><br>            }<span class="line"><!---->            }<!----></span><br>            weak_ptr->retrying_ = false;<span class="line"><!---->            weak_ptr-&gt;retrying_ = false;<!----></span><br>            if (PerfettoTracedProcess::Get()->CanStartTracing(<span class="line"><!---->            if (PerfettoTracedProcess::Get()-&gt;CanStartTracing(<!----></span><br>                    weak_ptr.get(), base::OnceClosure())) {<span class="line"><!---->                    weak_ptr.get(), base::OnceClosure())) {<!----></span><br>              weak_ptr->Connect();  // here will cause data race.<span class="line"><!---->              weak_ptr-&gt;Connect();  // here will cause data race.<!----></span><br>            } else {<span class="line"><!---->            } else {<!----></span><br>              weak_ptr->DelayedReconnect();<span class="line"><!---->              weak_ptr-&gt;DelayedReconnect();<!----></span><br>            }<span class="line"><!---->            }<!----></span><br>          },<span class="line"><!---->          },<!----></span><br>          weak_ptr_factory_.GetWeakPtr()),<span class="line"><!---->          weak_ptr_factory_.GetWeakPtr()),<!----></span><br>      base::Milliseconds(connection_backoff_ms_));<span class="line"><!---->      base::Milliseconds(connection_backoff_ms_));<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>maybe you can CC <span class="line"><!---->maybe you can CC <!----></span>nuskos@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/nuskos@chromium.org"><!---->nuskos@chromium.org<!----></a> to look at this bug.<span class="line"><!----> to look at this bug.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        CommandLine is okay to read across threads.<span class="line"><!---->CommandLine is okay to read across threads.<!----></span><br><br>  // Get the singleton CommandLine representing the current process's<span class="line"><!---->  // Get the singleton CommandLine representing the current process's<!----></span><br>  // command line. Note: returned value is mutable, but not thread safe;<span class="line"><!---->  // command line. Note: returned value is mutable, but not thread safe;<!----></span><br>  // only mutate if you know what you're doing!<span class="line"><!---->  // only mutate if you know what you're doing!<!----></span><br>  static CommandLine* ForCurrentProcess();<span class="line"><!---->  static CommandLine* ForCurrentProcess();<!----></span><br><br>But not to edit.<span class="line"><!---->But not to edit.<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ash/display/window_tree_host_manager.cc;drc=29350263b305b4713eda73bd86ba1cd5ddd4f540;l=888<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ash/display/window_tree_host_manager.cc;drc=29350263b305b4713eda73bd86ba1cd5ddd4f540;l=888"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ash/display/window_tree_host_manager.cc;drc=29350263b305b4713eda73bd86ba1cd5ddd4f540;l=888<!----></a><br><br>WindowTreeHostManager is writing to the CommandLine after initialization which is bad and creates this thread race. It could be a security bug as the data structure behind CommandLine contains pointers and the update could leave pointers in a bad state. However it would not be reliable for a renderer to exploit likely. So I will degrade the impact from critical.<span class="line"><!---->WindowTreeHostManager is writing to the CommandLine after initialization which is bad and creates this thread race. It could be a security bug as the data structure behind CommandLine contains pointers and the update could leave pointers in a bad state. However it would not be reliable for a renderer to exploit likely. So I will degrade the impact from critical.<!----></span><br><br>This bug was introduced here: <span class="line"><!---->This bug was introduced here: <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/3fcfa32692cd6506ecb8ed3a5a5f492ed750ab8c<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/3fcfa32692cd6506ecb8ed3a5a5f492ed750ab8c"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/3fcfa32692cd6506ecb8ed3a5a5f492ed750ab8c<!----></a><br><br><br>Temporary fix for rendering corruption on 4K or larger displays.<span class="line"><!---->Temporary fix for rendering corruption on 4K or larger displays.<!----></span><br><br>This change temporarily increases the compositor memory limit for<span class="line"><!---->This change temporarily increases the compositor memory limit for<!----></span><br>displays that are 4K or larger. The rendering was using up more memory<span class="line"><!---->displays that are 4K or larger. The rendering was using up more memory<!----></span><br>than expected, hitting the limit and causing parts of the UI to not be<span class="line"><!---->than expected, hitting the limit and causing parts of the UI to not be<!----></span><br>rendered.<span class="line"><!---->rendered.<!----></span><br><br>Tested with emulator with a large display size and confirmed the memory<span class="line"><!---->Tested with emulator with a large display size and confirmed the memory<!----></span><br>limit was increased.<span class="line"><!---->limit was increased.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1261776<span class="line"><!---->Bug: 1261776<!----></span><br>Change-Id: I502323d6098fda5d96cb28c76aad4debecd3d3ee<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: I502323d6098fda5d96cb28c76aad4debecd3d3ee<!----></span><br>Reviewed-on: <span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-on: <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3413653<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3413653"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3413653<!----></a><br>Reviewed-by: Mitsuru Oshima <<span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-by: Mitsuru Oshima &lt;<!----></span>oshima@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/oshima@chromium.org"><!---->oshima@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br><br>The fix is to mutate the CommandLine at startup and not after other threads have started.<span class="line"><!---->The fix is to mutate the CommandLine at startup and not after other threads have started.<!----></span><br><br>The CL was merged to M99, otherwise it would be only on M100.<span class="line"><!---->The CL was merged to M99, otherwise it would be only on M100.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        from sanitizer output, your file seems run in main thread, but the function ```PosixSystemProducer::DelayedReconnect()``` <span class="line"><!---->from sanitizer output, your file seems run in main thread, but the function ```PosixSystemProducer::DelayedReconnect()``` <!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>  task_runner()->GetOrCreateTaskRunner()->PostDelayedTask(<span class="line"><!---->  task_runner()-&gt;GetOrCreateTaskRunner()-&gt;PostDelayedTask(<!----></span><br>      FROM_HERE,<span class="line"><!---->      FROM_HERE,<!----></span><br>      base::BindOnce(<span class="line"><!---->      base::BindOnce(<!----></span><br>          [](base::WeakPtr<PosixSystemProducer> weak_ptr) {<span class="line"><!---->          [](base::WeakPtr&lt;PosixSystemProducer&gt; weak_ptr) {<!----></span><br>            if (!weak_ptr) {<span class="line"><!---->            if (!weak_ptr) {<!----></span><br>              return;<span class="line"><!---->              return;<!----></span><br>            }<span class="line"><!---->            }<!----></span><br>            weak_ptr->retrying_ = false;<span class="line"><!---->            weak_ptr-&gt;retrying_ = false;<!----></span><br>            if (PerfettoTracedProcess::Get()->CanStartTracing(<span class="line"><!---->            if (PerfettoTracedProcess::Get()-&gt;CanStartTracing(<!----></span><br>                    weak_ptr.get(), base::OnceClosure())) {<span class="line"><!---->                    weak_ptr.get(), base::OnceClosure())) {<!----></span><br>              weak_ptr->Connect();  // here will cause data race.<span class="line"><!---->              weak_ptr-&gt;Connect();  // here will cause data race.<!----></span><br>            } else {<span class="line"><!---->            } else {<!----></span><br>              weak_ptr->DelayedReconnect();<span class="line"><!---->              weak_ptr-&gt;DelayedReconnect();<!----></span><br>            }<span class="line"><!---->            }<!----></span><br>          },<span class="line"><!---->          },<!----></span><br>          weak_ptr_factory_.GetWeakPtr()),<span class="line"><!---->          weak_ptr_factory_.GetWeakPtr()),<!----></span><br>      base::Milliseconds(connection_backoff_ms_));<span class="line"><!---->      base::Milliseconds(connection_backoff_ms_));<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>maybe you can CC <span class="line"><!---->maybe you can CC <!----></span>nuskos@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/nuskos@chromium.org"><!---->nuskos@chromium.org<!----></a> to look at this bug.<span class="line"><!----> to look at this bug.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        This appears to be a data race upon startup and not an exploitable issue, and ineligible for a VRP reward. If you are able to demonstrate exploitability of this issue, we would be happy to reassess for a potential reward amount.<span class="line"><!---->This appears to be a data race upon startup and not an exploitable issue, and ineligible for a VRP reward. If you are able to demonstrate exploitability of this issue, we would be happy to reassess for a potential reward amount.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          <strong><!---->Owner:</strong>

        CommandLine is okay to read across threads.<span class="line"><!---->CommandLine is okay to read across threads.<!----></span><br><br>  // Get the singleton CommandLine representing the current process's<span class="line"><!---->  // Get the singleton CommandLine representing the current process's<!----></span><br>  // command line. Note: returned value is mutable, but not thread safe;<span class="line"><!---->  // command line. Note: returned value is mutable, but not thread safe;<!----></span><br>  // only mutate if you know what you're doing!<span class="line"><!---->  // only mutate if you know what you're doing!<!----></span><br>  static CommandLine* ForCurrentProcess();<span class="line"><!---->  static CommandLine* ForCurrentProcess();<!----></span><br><br>But not to edit.<span class="line"><!---->But not to edit.<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ash/display/window_tree_host_manager.cc;drc=29350263b305b4713eda73bd86ba1cd5ddd4f540;l=888<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ash/display/window_tree_host_manager.cc;drc=29350263b305b4713eda73bd86ba1cd5ddd4f540;l=888"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ash/display/window_tree_host_manager.cc;drc=29350263b305b4713eda73bd86ba1cd5ddd4f540;l=888<!----></a><br><br>WindowTreeHostManager is writing to the CommandLine after initialization which is bad and creates this thread race. It could be a security bug as the data structure behind CommandLine contains pointers and the update could leave pointers in a bad state. However it would not be reliable for a renderer to exploit likely. So I will degrade the impact from critical.<span class="line"><!---->WindowTreeHostManager is writing to the CommandLine after initialization which is bad and creates this thread race. It could be a security bug as the data structure behind CommandLine contains pointers and the update could leave pointers in a bad state. However it would not be reliable for a renderer to exploit likely. So I will degrade the impact from critical.<!----></span><br><br>This bug was introduced here: <span class="line"><!---->This bug was introduced here: <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/3fcfa32692cd6506ecb8ed3a5a5f492ed750ab8c<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/3fcfa32692cd6506ecb8ed3a5a5f492ed750ab8c"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/3fcfa32692cd6506ecb8ed3a5a5f492ed750ab8c<!----></a><br><br><br>Temporary fix for rendering corruption on 4K or larger displays.<span class="line"><!---->Temporary fix for rendering corruption on 4K or larger displays.<!----></span><br><br>This change temporarily increases the compositor memory limit for<span class="line"><!---->This change temporarily increases the compositor memory limit for<!----></span><br>displays that are 4K or larger. The rendering was using up more memory<span class="line"><!---->displays that are 4K or larger. The rendering was using up more memory<!----></span><br>than expected, hitting the limit and causing parts of the UI to not be<span class="line"><!---->than expected, hitting the limit and causing parts of the UI to not be<!----></span><br>rendered.<span class="line"><!---->rendered.<!----></span><br><br>Tested with emulator with a large display size and confirmed the memory<span class="line"><!---->Tested with emulator with a large display size and confirmed the memory<!----></span><br>limit was increased.<span class="line"><!---->limit was increased.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1261776<span class="line"><!---->Bug: 1261776<!----></span><br>Change-Id: I502323d6098fda5d96cb28c76aad4debecd3d3ee<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: I502323d6098fda5d96cb28c76aad4debecd3d3ee<!----></span><br>Reviewed-on: <span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-on: <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3413653<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3413653"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3413653<!----></a><br>Reviewed-by: Mitsuru Oshima <<span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-by: Mitsuru Oshima &lt;<!----></span>oshima@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/oshima@chromium.org"><!---->oshima@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br><br>The fix is to mutate the CommandLine at startup and not after other threads have started.<span class="line"><!---->The fix is to mutate the CommandLine at startup and not after other threads have started.<!----></span><br><br>The CL was merged to M99, otherwise it would be only on M100.<span class="line"><!---->The CL was merged to M99, otherwise it would be only on M100.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        from sanitizer output, your file seems run in main thread, but the function ```PosixSystemProducer::DelayedReconnect()``` <span class="line"><!---->from sanitizer output, your file seems run in main thread, but the function ```PosixSystemProducer::DelayedReconnect()``` <!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>  task_runner()->GetOrCreateTaskRunner()->PostDelayedTask(<span class="line"><!---->  task_runner()-&gt;GetOrCreateTaskRunner()-&gt;PostDelayedTask(<!----></span><br>      FROM_HERE,<span class="line"><!---->      FROM_HERE,<!----></span><br>      base::BindOnce(<span class="line"><!---->      base::BindOnce(<!----></span><br>          [](base::WeakPtr<PosixSystemProducer> weak_ptr) {<span class="line"><!---->          [](base::WeakPtr&lt;PosixSystemProducer&gt; weak_ptr) {<!----></span><br>            if (!weak_ptr) {<span class="line"><!---->            if (!weak_ptr) {<!----></span><br>              return;<span class="line"><!---->              return;<!----></span><br>            }<span class="line"><!---->            }<!----></span><br>            weak_ptr->retrying_ = false;<span class="line"><!---->            weak_ptr-&gt;retrying_ = false;<!----></span><br>            if (PerfettoTracedProcess::Get()->CanStartTracing(<span class="line"><!---->            if (PerfettoTracedProcess::Get()-&gt;CanStartTracing(<!----></span><br>                    weak_ptr.get(), base::OnceClosure())) {<span class="line"><!---->                    weak_ptr.get(), base::OnceClosure())) {<!----></span><br>              weak_ptr->Connect();  // here will cause data race.<span class="line"><!---->              weak_ptr-&gt;Connect();  // here will cause data race.<!----></span><br>            } else {<span class="line"><!---->            } else {<!----></span><br>              weak_ptr->DelayedReconnect();<span class="line"><!---->              weak_ptr-&gt;DelayedReconnect();<!----></span><br>            }<span class="line"><!---->            }<!----></span><br>          },<span class="line"><!---->          },<!----></span><br>          weak_ptr_factory_.GetWeakPtr()),<span class="line"><!---->          weak_ptr_factory_.GetWeakPtr()),<!----></span><br>      base::Milliseconds(connection_backoff_ms_));<span class="line"><!---->      base::Milliseconds(connection_backoff_ms_));<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>maybe you can CC <span class="line"><!---->maybe you can CC <!----></span>nuskos@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/nuskos@chromium.org"><!---->nuskos@chromium.org<!----></a> to look at this bug.<span class="line"><!----> to look at this bug.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Assigned
          (was: Unconfirmed)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          aluh@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Cc:</strong>

        CommandLine is okay to read across threads.<span class="line"><!---->CommandLine is okay to read across threads.<!----></span><br><br>  // Get the singleton CommandLine representing the current process's<span class="line"><!---->  // Get the singleton CommandLine representing the current process's<!----></span><br>  // command line. Note: returned value is mutable, but not thread safe;<span class="line"><!---->  // command line. Note: returned value is mutable, but not thread safe;<!----></span><br>  // only mutate if you know what you're doing!<span class="line"><!---->  // only mutate if you know what you're doing!<!----></span><br>  static CommandLine* ForCurrentProcess();<span class="line"><!---->  static CommandLine* ForCurrentProcess();<!----></span><br><br>But not to edit.<span class="line"><!---->But not to edit.<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ash/display/window_tree_host_manager.cc;drc=29350263b305b4713eda73bd86ba1cd5ddd4f540;l=888<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ash/display/window_tree_host_manager.cc;drc=29350263b305b4713eda73bd86ba1cd5ddd4f540;l=888"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ash/display/window_tree_host_manager.cc;drc=29350263b305b4713eda73bd86ba1cd5ddd4f540;l=888<!----></a><br><br>WindowTreeHostManager is writing to the CommandLine after initialization which is bad and creates this thread race. It could be a security bug as the data structure behind CommandLine contains pointers and the update could leave pointers in a bad state. However it would not be reliable for a renderer to exploit likely. So I will degrade the impact from critical.<span class="line"><!---->WindowTreeHostManager is writing to the CommandLine after initialization which is bad and creates this thread race. It could be a security bug as the data structure behind CommandLine contains pointers and the update could leave pointers in a bad state. However it would not be reliable for a renderer to exploit likely. So I will degrade the impact from critical.<!----></span><br><br>This bug was introduced here: <span class="line"><!---->This bug was introduced here: <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/3fcfa32692cd6506ecb8ed3a5a5f492ed750ab8c<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/3fcfa32692cd6506ecb8ed3a5a5f492ed750ab8c"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/3fcfa32692cd6506ecb8ed3a5a5f492ed750ab8c<!----></a><br><br><br>Temporary fix for rendering corruption on 4K or larger displays.<span class="line"><!---->Temporary fix for rendering corruption on 4K or larger displays.<!----></span><br><br>This change temporarily increases the compositor memory limit for<span class="line"><!---->This change temporarily increases the compositor memory limit for<!----></span><br>displays that are 4K or larger. The rendering was using up more memory<span class="line"><!---->displays that are 4K or larger. The rendering was using up more memory<!----></span><br>than expected, hitting the limit and causing parts of the UI to not be<span class="line"><!---->than expected, hitting the limit and causing parts of the UI to not be<!----></span><br>rendered.<span class="line"><!---->rendered.<!----></span><br><br>Tested with emulator with a large display size and confirmed the memory<span class="line"><!---->Tested with emulator with a large display size and confirmed the memory<!----></span><br>limit was increased.<span class="line"><!---->limit was increased.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1261776<span class="line"><!---->Bug: 1261776<!----></span><br>Change-Id: I502323d6098fda5d96cb28c76aad4debecd3d3ee<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: I502323d6098fda5d96cb28c76aad4debecd3d3ee<!----></span><br>Reviewed-on: <span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-on: <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3413653<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3413653"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3413653<!----></a><br>Reviewed-by: Mitsuru Oshima <<span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-by: Mitsuru Oshima &lt;<!----></span>oshima@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/oshima@chromium.org"><!---->oshima@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br><br>The fix is to mutate the CommandLine at startup and not after other threads have started.<span class="line"><!---->The fix is to mutate the CommandLine at startup and not after other threads have started.<!----></span><br><br>The CL was merged to M99, otherwise it would be only on M100.<span class="line"><!---->The CL was merged to M99, otherwise it would be only on M100.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        by

        from sanitizer output, your file seems run in main thread, but the function ```PosixSystemProducer::DelayedReconnect()``` <span class="line"><!---->from sanitizer output, your file seems run in main thread, but the function ```PosixSystemProducer::DelayedReconnect()``` <!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>  task_runner()->GetOrCreateTaskRunner()->PostDelayedTask(<span class="line"><!---->  task_runner()-&gt;GetOrCreateTaskRunner()-&gt;PostDelayedTask(<!----></span><br>      FROM_HERE,<span class="line"><!---->      FROM_HERE,<!----></span><br>      base::BindOnce(<span class="line"><!---->      base::BindOnce(<!----></span><br>          [](base::WeakPtr<PosixSystemProducer> weak_ptr) {<span class="line"><!---->          [](base::WeakPtr&lt;PosixSystemProducer&gt;            issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>

    <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>

          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>

      <chops-dialog closeonoutsideclick="">
        <h3 class="medium-heading">
          <span>Blocked on issues</span>
          <button aria-label="close">
            <i class="material-icons">close</i>
          </button>
        </h3>

          <tr>

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
